byline.original: By FRANK LITSKY and WILLIAM McDONALD

abstract: Norbert Schemansky, first American weight lifter to win medals in four Olympic Games who would later fall into obscurity despite his achievements, dies at age 92; became first man ever to lift 1200 pounds in clean and jerk, snatch and press.
lead_paragraph: In competition largely outside the sports world spotlight, he awed crowds and was the first to win medals in four Olympics but felt unappreciated in his hometown.
snippet: In competition largely outside the sports world spotlight, he awed crowds and was the first to win medals in four Olympics but felt unappreciated in his hometown....

headline.main: Norbert Schemansky, Who Won Weight-Lifting Gold but Little Applause Back Home, Dies at 92
headline.print_headline: Norbert Schemansky, Who Won Medals at Four Olympic Games, Is Dead at 92
